A mostly WhatWG compliant URL parser Parsing URLs

This example creates a URL parser, and parses a string to make it a URL type.

import ferus_sanchar

var parser = newURLParser()
let url = parser.parse("https://google.com")

doAssert url.getScheme() == "https"
doAssert url.getHostname() == "google.com"
doAssert url.getTLD() == "com"

Types

URL = ref object of RootObj
  scheme: string             ## The scheme of the URL.
  hostname: string           ## The hostname of the URL.
  port: uint                 ## The port of the URL.
  portRaw: string            ## The raw string representing the port of the URL.
  path: string               ## The path of the URL.
  fragment: string           ## The fragment of the URL.
  query*: string             ## The query of the URL.
  parsedScheme: bool
  parsedHostname: bool
  parsedPort: bool
  parsedPath: bool
  parsedFragment: bool

URLDefect = Defect
URLParseDefect = Defect
URLParser = ref object of RootObj
  state: URLParserState

URLParserState = enum
  sInit, parseScheme, parseHostname, parsePort, parsePath, parseFragment,
  parseQuery, sEnd, limbo

Procs

proc `$`(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Turn the URL back into a string representation This can turn a URL back into string form
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert $url == "https://google.com/"
proc getFragment(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the fragment of the URL, granted it exists
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getFragment() == ""
proc getHostname(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the hostname of a URL
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getHostname() == "google.com"
proc getPath(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the path of the URL, granted the URL has one
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getPath() == ""
proc getPort(url: URL): uint {.inline, ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Get the port of the URL which is an unsigned integer
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getPort() == 443
proc getScheme(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the scheme of a URL
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getScheme() == "https"
proc getTLD(url: URL): string {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the TLD domain for this URL. It does not need to be a real TLD (eg. test.blahblahblah).
import ferus_sanchar

let url = URL(
  scheme: "https",
  hostname: "google.com",
  port: 443,
  portRaw: "443",
  path: "",
  fragment: "",
  query: ""
)

doAssert url.getTLD() == "com"
proc newURL(scheme, hostname, path, fragment: string; port: uint = 0): URL {.
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Create a new URL object, takes in the scheme, hostname, path, fragment and port.
let url = newURL("https", "google.com", "", "", 443)
proc newURLParser(): URLParser {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Create a new URL parser Initialize a new URLParser with the state set to sInit
var parser = newURLParser()
proc parse(parser: URLParser; src: string): URL {.
    ...raises: [ValueError, KeyError], tags: [].}
Parse a string into a URL, granted it is not malformed.
import ferus_sanchar

var urlParser = newURLParser()
let url = urlParser.parse("https://google.com")
